oai_dc:dc.dc:title: VELOCITIES UNDER PERIODIC AND RANDOM WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lee, Allen
Greated, Clive A.
Durrani, Tariq S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: random wave
periodic wave
velocity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Using the linear approximation for predicting velocities under periodic water waves, relationships are established between the velocity spectrum and the surface elevation spectrum for three-dimensional waves. The two dimensional forms of these relationships are used for comparison with velocity and elevation spectra measured in a laboratory wave tank. The predicted distortion of the spectrum shape can be observed in the experimental results. Velocity measurements were recorded using a laser velocimeter employing a rotating diffraction grating for shifting the optical frequencies. This allows measurement without sign ambiguity. The random waves were generated using a servodriven paddle with a filtered white noise input.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 14 (1974): Proceedings of 14th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1974.; 31
